meanings.definition: The state or condition of being liked, admired, or supported by many people.
meanings.sent1: Her popularities among her classmates made her feel happy and included.
meanings.sent2: The singer's popularities grew after releasing a hit song.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's popularities at the park were evident as everyone wanted to pet him.
meanings.sent4: The popularities of the new restaurant spread like wildfire through the town.
meanings.sent5: The popularities of kindness and generosity are always appreciated by others.

meanings.definition: The quality of being widely accepted or recognized.
meanings.sent1: The popularities of the brand were evident in its high sales numbers.
meanings.sent2: His popularities as a leader were acknowledged by people from different backgrounds.
meanings.sent3: The popularities of the new fashion trend were undeniable as everyone started wearing it.
meanings.sent4: The popularities of honesty and integrity are values that should be cherished.
meanings.sent5: The popularities of the artist's work were celebrated by art enthusiasts.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something is favored or well-liked by a large number of people.
meanings.sent1: The popularities of the movie led to sold-out screenings every night.
meanings.sent2: The popularities of the dessert were evident by how quickly it sold out at the bakery.
meanings.sent3: The popularities of the new video game were so high that it became a cultural phenomenon.
meanings.sent4: The popularities of the book soared after receiving rave reviews from critics.
meanings.sent5: The popularities of the team's performance made them the talk of the town.
